channel.title: MochiKit Google Group
channel.description: Discussions related to development of and with the MochiKit JavaScript library

item.title: Last call for MochiKit 1.4
item.description:
Hi everyone,
This is just to say that I'm still planning to do the MochiKit 1.4
release on the 21:st of October. All outstanding bugs remain fixed and
I've heard of no test breakage. Please let me know if you find any
last-minute-issues.
Cheers
/Per
item.author: cederb...@gmail.com (Per Cederberg)

item.title: Migrate to Google Code?
item.description:
I've been considering this for a while but didn't want to put forth
the effort at the time, but I think that with the release of 1.4 it
would be a good time to migrate from the Mochi Media hosted Trac and
SVN over to something else. My personal preference is Google Code
because we already use that for our other open source projects and it
item.author: b...@redivi.com (Bob Ippolito)

item.title: Why doesn't removeElement use the DOM Coercion rules?
item.description:
I don't know if I am "up in the night" on this or if it is an oversight, but
why doesn't removeElement use the DOM Coercion rules in the same way that
something like appendChildNodes does? Here's some sample code that
illustrates my problem:
function MyWidget() {

var widgetDomRepresentation = DIV({style:"border:solid 1px"}, "Hi!");
item.author: thurber_min...@hotmail.com (Jason Bunting)

item.title: Preparing for a MochiKit 1.4 release
item.description:
Hi everyone,
This is a long email in the series "why don't we release 1.4
already?". But at least I tried to shorten down the opinion pieces.
Personally I think it is important that we do a release of version
1.4. Other projects (e.g. TurboGears) tend to depend on stable
releases. And it is good advertising for the project to have regular
item.author: cederb...@gmail.com (Per Cederberg)

item.title: MochiKit.DOM.isChildNode and isParent
item.description:
The two functions MochiKit.DOM.isChildNode and isParent have both been
added in version 1.4 of MochiKit (not yet stable). But they are
virtually identical (except for a few bugs I'm in fixing right now).
The only difference, according to the API docs, as far as I can tell
is:
isChildNode(node, node) --> true
item.author: cederb...@gmail.com (Per Cederberg)

item.title: MochiKit.Test and SimpleTest.js
item.description:
While fixing some stuff in MochiKit.Logging, I happened to notice the
existance of a MochiKit.Test package... It seems pretty similar to the
SimpleTest.js file used for powering the normal test suite when run
inside a browser, but it seems to only be used when standalone testing
is performed (e.g. from the scripts/rhinomochi.js file).
item.author: cederb...@gmail.com (Per Cederberg)

item.title: Including MochiKit.DragAndDrop and MochiKit.Sortable in the packed version?
item.description:
The packed version of MochiKit still doesn't include the modules
DragAndDrop and Sortable. I found a previous discussion of that in
this thread:
[link]
None of the two modules have been much modified lately, so perhaps
item.author: cederb...@gmail.com (Per Cederberg)

item.title: Class inheritance
item.description:
Ok, I've searched through the archives for posts referencing the word
"inheritance" but most of them are just referring to prototype and the
lack of scope that JS gives you if you don't bindMethods(this)
I'm asking about actual OO inheritance in this post, wherein a class
inherits methods from another class.
item.author: eamonn.kea...@so-4pt.net (Akari no ryu)

item.title: How can I refresh a particular div in a document
item.description:
Hi All,
I am new to AJAX and Mochikit.
I have the JSON objects(got from the XMLHttpRequest) and I want to
refresh a particular div of a document with the JSON data (without
refreshing the whole page). Needing help.

Presently now I am doing everything on the fly

Thanks,
Ranjan
item.author: ranjan.n...@gmail.com (Ranjan)

item.title: MochiKit.Async.doXHR
item.description:
I've been battling with this for a few hours now, been reading the
docs and read this groups mails on defferred.callback
None of that seems to help.
My code does the following:

this.interfaceTypes = {
'lines':false,
'regions':false,
'points':false
};
for(var i in this.interfaceTypes)
item.author: eamonn.kea...@so-4pt.net (Akari no ryu)

item.title: deferred.callback is not bound
item.description:
var d = new Deferred();
d.addCallback(partial(log, "whee"));

succeed().addCallback(d.callba ck, 1);

Blows up on line 92 of Async.js in:

this._check();

'this' is 'window', which makes me think deferreds methods are not
bound?
if I call bindMethods(d); it -works- but still raises an exception.
item.author: tjstebb...@gmail.com (tjs)

item.title: Formatting strings, numbers and stuff
item.description:
I guess this is a question for Bob, but others might have some clues
here also. Thus sending it to the list.
I've recently done some Python coding and found the % string formating
there very convenient. Now, as MochiKit is so inspired by Python, I
find it a bit odd that there is no generic string formatting similar
item.author: cederb...@gmail.com (Per Cederberg)

item.title: Ajax Dom Replacement
item.description:
I would like to change a DOM Object with a turbogears ajax call.
At the moment the ajax call returns a string with the html of the node
that should be replaced. How can I swap the existing DOM Object with
the new one I got from the ajax callback?

InnerHTML replaces the inner part of the element, but I want to
item.author: g...@gregor-horvath.com (gregor)

item.title: MochiKit Extensions
item.description:
Hello Everyone,

As said before, I'm working on some extension modules for MochiKit.
Those are..

1) MochiKit.Query - provides jQuery style DOM manipulation/traversing
functionality
2) MochiKit.Remote - an implementation of MochiKit.Async
3) MochiKit.Extensions - extension helpers

The Query module is based on MochiKit.Selector so selector features
item.author: mendapara.a...@gmail.com (Amit Mendapara)

item.title: help with createDOM
item.description:
Hello,

I'm new to mochikit, i'm trying to use it to create HTML fragments
with DOM api (i'm using mochikit from SVN).

The following code is working :

//---------------------------- ------------------------------ ------
var new_node = H1('hello');
var target = document.getElementById('title ');
item.author: bilb...@gmail.com (bilboon@gmail.com)
